Articles.Content:
Hello all, relatively new player on KSP and love the game. 

Right now I am having trouble assembling my Mun base. I was able to land multiple modules on the Mun but cannot get a suitable Rover assembled to start docking them together. My main problem is that, when testing the rover, I am able to 1) drive the rover undocked - 2) dock the rover with the module - and 3) support the module in cantilever fashion. However, once docked the rover fails to drive at all. The front and rear wheels start acting weird (going pigeon toe instead of steering together) and the rover refuses to drive forward.

Any advise as to what I am doing wrong? I added a screenshot of mysetup....docked with the module.

When you connect the parts, it sounds like the assembly has a different orientation because it is figuring from a different control point. R-click on the rover's capsule or probe core and click "control from here." I suspect that will fix your problem. Watch the navball while you do this.

Also, welcome to the forum.

Greetings and welcome to the forums @NeilKerman.

I agree with the Vanamonde's advice.  I would love to see your base but I cannot see a screenshot in your post.  If you post your image to Imgur and then copy and paste the "html code" into your post the forum software will display your image.
Thanks guys that did the trick! The Mun base is successfully coming together now. Now just to get the fuel level high enough to satisfy the mission requirements.
